properties.address: 86 - 88 Wilbraham Road, Manchester, Lancashire M14 7DR
properties.description: Fallowfield Secret Garden is a volunteer-led, urban Permaculture project which aims to develop a beautiful, biodiverse green space for the local community to meet, eat, learn and play. The project was set up in 2011 and has gone from strength to strength through the support of local volunteers and neighbours. Our 1.5-acre site, hidden away in the middle of a housing estate, has been transformed from an overgrown wasteland to a thriving community space which now includes a vegetable garden, kid’s forest play area, orchard, wildlife pond, medicinal garden and a wooden roundhouse. The garden is run by a core group of 10-15 volunteers who give their time each week to make sure it is open for anyone to join, whether volunteer or just to visit. We are open all year round for at least 3 days per week. Members of the core group divide the responsibilities for leading different projects onsite, running activities/events with overarching responsibilities including communications and volunteer coordination. We are a constituted community group with a Board comprising a Chair, Secretary and Treasurer. Decisions are made by consensus in meetings, or decision-making can be devolved to working groups with specific responsibilities and roles.
properties.title: Fallowfield Secret Garden

properties.address: J N R 8 Youth & Community Centre, Manchester, Greater Manchester M16 0BG
properties.description: Whalley Range Community Forum and Manley Park Methodist Church welcome you to our community warm hub on Fridays from 10.00 - 13.00. JNR8 (pronounced generate) is a warm and welcoming space for our community to meet with others, have a cuppa and a crumpet/piece of toast, fruit - and soup and a roll when the weather gets colder! Bring a friend along - or come along on your own and make new friends! We have board games and art materials - or bring your own knitting/craft project along to work on - or you can just sit and read a book. We are a foodbank partner so can help those in food poverty with a foodbank voucher. We often have free bags of essentials such as toiletries and household cleaning products to give away - and a free pre-loved clothes rail to look through. (Also limited SIM cards with free calls and data: ask Chris for details) We invite guests such as Citizens Advice, Scam Awareness, local PCSO's and Councillors - to help with any issues you may have. We can also signpost you to services that might be able to help you if you are struggling. Come and join us at the JNR8 Community Hub for a warm welcome! (the centre is open throughout the week with a range of activities: pop in to check our timetable)
properties.title: JNR8 Youth & Community Centre and Manley Park Methodist church

properties.description: The Strawberry Fox cafe is situated in the heart of Northern Moor, close to local amenities and transport links. Based in the grounds of Pioneer House High School the cafe is run by our passionate and talented students under the supervision of our team of dedicated school staff. Our charming cafe invites you to savour not only the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee and baked pastries, but also the warmth of a welcoming atmosphere.
properties.title: The Strawberry Fox Cafe

properties.description: Drop-in with hot drinks and cakes. Walking football and table tennis. Board games. People to talk to. Optional prayer space. The Vine is warm welcoming space. properties.title: The Vine at Trinity Baptist Church, Gorton

properties.address: Tree Of Life Centre, Manchester, Greater Manchester M23 2UE
properties.description: Our warm & welcoming space is open to all Monday-Friday 10am-3pm & Saturday 10am-2pm.Our community cafe serves fresh healthy low cost breakfast & lunch. You can enjoy a warming bowl of soup for £1.00 tea& coffee is just 60p.Spend time browsing our Pre loved furniture shop or pick up a bargain from our Clothes/Bric a Brac .We are a one stop shop supporting those most in need in our community
properties.title: Tree of Life Centre Wythenshawe

properties.description: a place were you can come in, have a cup of tea/coffee a slice of toast and a chat.
properties.title: warm hub

properties.address: 38 Rowcon Close, Audenshaw, Greater Manchester M34 5AS
properties.description: We are inviting you to come along to a warm and friendly space at Audenshaw Home & Community Hub, which is open to everyone. Every Monday between 12-2pm, we offer a Free hot meal and hot & cold drinks.. This is a relaxed space to enjoy activities, make new friends and socialise. There is an opportunity for customers to engage in various activities which the local community group organise, such as games night, coffee morning and more. Free Wi-Fi available at the venue. Disabled access to the building and toilets.
properties.title: Warm Hub at Jigsaw Homes & Community Hub

properties.address: Crumpsall Community Hall, MANCHESTER M8 4GS
properties.description: This space is open to all to have free hot drink, hot meal, make new friends along with arts and crafts
properties.title: Warm Welcome supported by Jigsaw Homes

properties.address: Westcroft Community Centre, Lancashire M20 6EF
properties.description: Westcroft Community Centre exists to empower, inspire and improve the local community. We provide support, activities and opportunities for all centre users and volunteers to realise their potential in a safe, welcoming and inclusive environment. With a wide range of free to access activities all week every week we are open to all. With free hot drinks at all times anyone can drop by for as long as they wish to keep warm, drink lots of hot brews, chat and learn more about what services and activities we deliver. We are open for advice and guidance, food support, social activities, events, film nights, womens group, weekly cooking, Wednesday socials, Storytelling, painting and much, much more.
properties.title: Westcroft Community Centre
